channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Crickhowell rape: Police search for masked men after woman attacked
item.description: The "harrowing" early hours attack happened in a residential cul-de-sac in a small rural town.

item.title: 'Alarming' Swansea carer shortage prompts family SOS call
item.description: Family members are being encouraged to learn nursing tasks, such as changing dressings.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Self-isolation rules to ease for double jabbed
item.description: Wales will be the first part of the UK to stop telling fully vaccinated adults to self-isolate.

item.title: Covid: Cardiff woman 'cut by razor behind anti-mask poster'
item.description: Layla Stokes says she has been to the doctor to have the cut tested for any diseases.

item.title: Cardiff: Murder arrest after sudden death of woman
item.description: Police say they are not looking for anyone else in connection with the woman's death.

item.title: Anglesey: Crossbow attack leaves farm animals seriously injured
item.description: A calf is expected to survive despite being shot in the eye and two rams were shot with a crossbow.

item.title: Callum Jones, 20, left paralysed after running into sea
item.description: Callum Jones ran into the water and hit something beneath the surface.

item.title: Blaenau Gwent council boss defends colleague's two salaries
item.description: Opposition councillors say the move is "not the right thing to do in the face of the public".

item.title: Covid infections estimated to have risen in Wales
item.description: According to a swap survey, an estimated 18,800 people across Wales have Covid.

item.title: Children in care: Lack of secure accommodation 'scandalous'
item.description: A supreme court judge says a lack of approved homes is causing an "extremely difficult situation".

item.title: Theatr Ardudwy: 'Fraudulent' theatre producer 'misled' community
item.description: Kallum O'Sullivan promised to reinvent Theatr Ardudwy after it closed in 2017 due to safety concerns.

item.title: Mobo: Welsh music of black origin project started to 'help give back'
item.description: The new project will allow five singers and producers to be mentored by music professionals.

item.title: Bradley John 'should be coming up to his 18th birthday'
item.description: Father of Bradley John, 14, says the fact he "took his life" at school is "very, very symbolic".

item.title: Talking Books Wales: How one woman helped so many blind people read
item.description: After losing her sight in her 30s, Rhian Evans says she "used that disability" to help others.

item.title: LGBTQ people 'need to be part of' Wales' awareness push
item.description: It is hoped a new plan will see LGBTQ+ rights made mainstream across schools and the public sector.

item.title: Welsh slate landscape crowned a World Heritage site
item.description: The slate landscape of north-west Wales becomes the 32 UK site to be on Unesco's heritage list.

item.title: Woman who died in 'severe' pain at Cardiff home waited 'hours' for ambulance
item.description: John Whale's wife Maria died after they waited more than two hours for an ambulance.

item.title: British and Irish Lions: Siya Kolisi "didn't feel respected at all" in first Test
item.description: South Africa captain Siya Kolisi says he "didn't feel respected at all" by the referee in the opening loss to the British and Irish Lions, backing claims made by Rassie Erasmus.

item.title: 2022 World Cup qualifiers: Wales to face Belarus in neutral venue in Russia
item.description: Wales' World Cup qualifier away to Belarus in September will be held at Central Stadium in Kazan, Russia.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Emotional Victoria Thornley reflects on family reunion after medal near-miss
item.description: Rower Vicky Thornley admits she is looking forward to being reunited with her family following her fourth-place finish in the single sculls at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Ollie Wynne-Griffith's rowing bronze ends 89-year family medal wait
item.description: Ollie Wynne-Griffith's Olympic rowing bronze as part of Team GB's men's eight crew creates family history after a near miss 89 years ago.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain beat USA to reach rugby sevens semi-final
item.description: Great Britain overcome the USA to reach the women's rugby sevens semi-final at the Olympic Games in Tokyo.

item.title: Heddlu'n chwilio am dri dyn wedi i ddynes gael ei threisio
item.description: Heddlu'n chwilio am dri dyn oedd yn gwisgo mygydau duon yn y digwyddiad yn Nghrughywel yn gynnar fore Mawrth.

item.title: Dim angen hunan-ynysu os ydych wedi'ch brechu'n llawn
item.description: Llywodraeth Cymru'n cyhoeddi newid i'r rheolau ar hunan-ynysu fydd mewn grym o 7 Awst ymlaen.

item.title: Y cyhoeddwr llyfrau a'r awdur Roger Boore wedi marw yn 82
item.description: Cafodd un o sylfaenwyr Gwasg y Dref Wen ei anrhydeddu am ei gyfraniad i faes llenyddiaeth plant.

item.title: Eisteddfod AmGen 2021: Gorsedd Cymru yn dychwelyd i'r prif seremonïau
item.description: Yr Archdderwydd Myrddin ap Dafydd sy'n trafod gwaith yr orsedd yn absenoldeb Eisteddfod draddodiadol.

item.title: Robin McBryde: 'Ni fydd sylwadau Erasmus yn cael effaith'
item.description: Cyhoeddodd Rassie Erasmus fideo yn beirniadu safon y dyfarnu yn y gêm rhwng De Affrica a'r Llewod.
